articles.title: Hackers Went Looking for a Backdoor in High-Security Safes—and Now Can Open Them in Seconds - WIRED
articles.description: Security researchers found two techniques to crack at least eight brands of electronic safes—used to secure everything from guns to narcotics—that are sold with Securam Prologic locks.

articles.title: Massive Pixel leak spoils everything ahead of Google launch event - Android Authority
articles.description: A massive leak has spilled the beans on not only the Pixel 10 series, but also the Pixel Watch 4 and Pixel Buds 2a.

articles.title: RIP, Microsoft Lens, a simple little app that’s getting replaced by AI - TechCrunch
articles.description: Microsoft is killing Lens, a handy mobile scanning app with over 90 million downloads.

articles.title: Tron: Catalyst & John Wick Hex Dev 'Bithell Games' Makes "Majority" Of Staff Redundant - Nintendo Life
See What Happens When You Fold the Samsung Galaxy Fold 7 200,000 Times - CNET
articles.description: We're a little concerned about the "unknown black liquid" that leaked out of the phone's hinge when a YouTuber tested it.

articles.title: Diablo 4 Boss Leaves Blizzard After 5 Years For Next Gig - Kotaku
articles.description: The industry veteran was in charge of Diablo IV

articles.title: Google Gemini struggles to write code, calls itself “a disgrace to my species” - Ars Technica
articles.description: Google still trying to fix “annoying infinite looping bug,” product manager says.

articles.title: iPhone 17 Pro Max: Three new upgrades that could be hard to resist - 9to5Mac
articles.description: iPhone 17 Pro Max will pack a variety of new features, but there are three upgrades in particular that have me considering a model change.

articles.title: Please, I'm Begging, Revive People In Battlefield 6's Open Beta - Kotaku
articles.description: In EA's new military FPS helping others is easy, but very few people are doing it

articles.title: Cheaters Already Spotted in Battlefield 6 Open Beta, Despite Secure Boot Requirement - IGN
articles.description: Battlefield 6 isn't even out yet, but cheaters have already infiltrated the Open Beta on PC. That's despite requiring players to enable Secure Boot to access the playtest.

articles.title: Sony Offers A Questionable ‘Marathon’ Release Date Update - Forbes
articles.description: On Sony's recent earnings call, they addressed the situation with Marathon and when they believe it may actually be released.

articles.title: Game Accused Of Copying Horizon Gets Radically Updated Steam Page - GameSpot
articles.description: Light of Motiram's updated Steam page appears to tone down the similarities it shares with Sony's Horizon franchise.

articles.title: 8BitDo Pro 3 review: a super customizable controller that’s frustratingly limited on Switch 2 - The Verge
articles.description: The 8BitDo Pro 3 looks a lot like its predecessor, but with better joysticks, and more buttons. But in the Switch 2 era, it’s not the best choice.

articles.title: Nintendo’s new Hello, Mario! mobile app lets kids play with Mario’s face - The Verge
articles.description: Nintendo’s new My Mario collection launches in Japan on August 26th, when its free Hello, Mario! app will be available for download.

articles.title: Google tests revamped Google Finance with AI upgrades, live news feed - TechCrunch
articles.description: Users will now be able to research their financial questions with AI, access advanced charting tools, and get real-time data and news.

articles.title: EA's "Madden 26" plagued with massive launch day errors - Axios
articles.description: Many "Madden NFL 26" gamers struggle to play at release time because of online server errors.

articles.title: Mafia: The Old Country – First PC Performance & DLSS 4 Impressions - DSOGaming
articles.description: Mafia: The Old Country uses Unreal Engine 5, and supports DLSS 4 with Multi-Frame Gen. So, here are our first PC performance impressions.

articles.title: No, Sony Statement Doesn’t Say PlayStation Is Going Multiplatform - PlayStation LifeStyle
articles.description: In what comes as no surprise, a viral tweet misrepresented a Sony statement to suggest that PlayStation is going multiplatform.

articles.title: Doom: The Dark Ages Price Drops $25 on PS5 After Its Official Update 2 Patch - IGN
articles.description: Doom: The Dark Ages is one of the best shooters of 2025, and now it's $25 off at Best Buy following the launch of its official Title Update 2.
